support_summary: As a core component of the ATG12-ATG5-ATG16L1 E3-like ligase complex, ATG16L1 acts as a scaffold to determine the specific site of LC3B lipidation and facilitates its transfer from ATG3 to PE on the phagophore membrane.

functions.cellular_process: Forms a large E3-like ligase complex with ATG5 and the ATG12 conjugate (ATG12-ATG5-ATG16L1). This complex localizes to the phagophore and determines the specific site where the ATG3-LC3B complex will conjugate LC3B to PE.
functions.effect_description: Acts as a scaffold to bring the E2 enzyme (ATG3-LC3B) into proximity with the membrane substrate (PE), thereby facilitating and specifying the location of LC3B lipidation.
biological_consequence: WIPI2 recruits ATG12-ATG5-ATG16L1 complex to PI3P on phagophore → ATG16L1 provides E3-like ligase activity → Recruits ATG3-LC3B complex → Site-specific conjugation of LC3B to PE (lipidation) → Phagophore membrane elongation
Site-specific LC3B lipidation → Efficient autophagosome elongation and curvature → Phagophore closure → Formation of a mature autophagosome
specific_effects: Provides E3-like ligase activity for the LC3 conjugation system
Directs LC3B lipidation to the growing phagophore membrane
Interacts with WIPI2 to localize to PI3P-rich domains on the phagophore
Essential for canonical autophagy and LC3-associated phagocytosis

effect: Acts as a scaffold to bring the E2 enzyme (ATG3-LC3B) into proximity with the membrane substrate (PE), thereby facilitating and specifying the location of LC3B lipidation.
summary: LC3B activates ATG16L1 to modulate lc3b lipidation site determination, ultimately affecting phagophore membrane elongation.
